title: Browder fixed-point theorem
summary: The Browder fixed-point theorem is a refinement of the Banach fixed-point theorem for uniformly convex Banach spaces. It asserts that if K {\displaystyle K} is a nonempty convex closed bounded set in uniformly convex Banach space and f {\displaystyle f} is a mapping of K {\displaystyle K} into itself such that ‖ f ( x ) − f ( y ) ‖ ≤ ‖ x − y ‖ {\displaystyle \|f(x)-f(y)\|\leq \|x-y\|} (i.e. f {\displaystyle f} is non-expansive), then f {\displaystyle f} has a fixed point.
